content.description:
Dido’s final struggle

Illa graves oculos conataconor, conari, conatus sum: try attollere rursus

deficit; infixum striditstrido, -ere: hiss, creak sub pectore vulnus.

Ter sese attollens cubitoquecubitum, -i, n.: elbow adnixaadnitor, adniti, adnixus sum: lean upon; strive, struggle levavit,

ter revoluta torotorus, -i , m.: couch est oculisque errantibus alto

(5) quaesivit caelo lucem ingemuitque repertareperio, -ire, repperi, repertus: find, discover.

Aeneid 4.688-692
content.question: Translate the passage as literally as possible.

frqParts.text: Translate the passage as literally as possible.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
